name: YOU
note: Nominated by Michael: 'Given the year we've had, you've made it to the end and so are fully deserving of this accolade! So let's look forward to 2021 as 2020 is so last year Grinning face with smiling eyes.'

name: Ben Dowen
note: Nominated by The Whole Test Community: 'Ben has done such a great thing by introducing a bit of positivity each day through #TesterofTheDay for the test community. We all really appreciate it!'

name: Many Kasiriha
note: Many provided an excellent and concise description of test strategy in an agile Context in response to a recent MoT question. He also has strong opinions on the debate on Testing vs Checking in automation.

name: Callum Akehurst-Ryan
note: Callum engages with the Software testing Community, promoting diversity and accessibility. On Callum's blog you will find topics covering Exploratory Testing, CI/CD and Dungeons and Dragons!

name: Venkat Ramakrishnan
note: Venkat contributes consistently to the Testing Community. He starts conversations, like his recent thread on The Club on BDD. He is very active on Twitter, so make sure to follow him!

name: David Duke
note: Nominated by Beth Marshall: 'For continuing to shine a bright ass spotlight on the actual reality of life as a tester in his brilliant Guilty Tester podcast series.'

name: Nicola Sedgwick
note: Nominated by Danny Dainton: Nicola is 100% one of those amazing people you just feel happy to be around. Super talented and each time we have spoken, I've ALWAYS learnt new things!! You're awesome!!

name: Gwen Diagram
note: Nominated by Michael: 'Gwen not only has an awesome name, she puts 100% into everything she does. Take a look at her dedication to The crystal maze quiz on her twitter feed. Deserving of tester of the week for that alone! She's also very active in interacting with the testing community.'

name: Alex Bauduin
note: Alex is an engaging speaker who has been doing a great job on the speaker circuit, he has time for everyone too

name: Johan Jonasson
note: Sharp and concise Johan is on point with his responses to the MoT daily questions and has written blogs on Conferences and Test Community.

name: Leigh Rathbone
note: Nominated by Louise Gibbs: 'his abilities as a conference speaker and host. As a host, he not only introduces the speakers, but he also supports us. He makes sure that we're calm, ready and not about to freak out. He also speaks a lot about his support for meetups, and (before the pandemic) took the effort to attend as many different ones as possible and not just local ones either. It was such a lovely surprise to see him at the #MidsTest meetup in Birmingham back in January - he travelled there all the way from Liverpool (I think that's where he lives).'

name: Karthik K.K
note: Nominated by Sanjay Kumar: 'His passion to share knowledge help millions of people to build their career. Karthik is an asset to Testing community. He is great mentor, Leader and Trainer for the testing Community.'

name: Stuart Crocker
note: Nominated by Lena Zubyete: for active support, mentoring and encouragement to fellow testers.

name: Jit Gosai
note: I've been a huge fan of Jit's work for a number of years now. Super inspiring person and I'm constantly learning new things from his talks and blog posts

name: Mark Winteringham
note: Nominated by Michael: 'Mark is big on Automation and knowledge sharing - being the Dojo Boss at the Ministry of Testing. Automation courses, Podcasts, you name it, he's helped set them up!'

name: Alapan Das
note: He helped me improve my CV. Guided me for sponsorship jobs in Europe and answers my stupid questions. He moved to Europe last year and has been a source of inspiration

name: Dan Billing
note: Nominated by Louise Gibbs: 'for the support and encouragement he gives to new speakers - at the pre-test bash Manchester meetup he gave a talk where he offered to help speakers develop a new talk.'

name: Mark Plettenberg
note: Nominated by Frans Wauters: 'Mark runs a lab and is very active in (and knowledgeable about) loadtesting vdi environments, besides taking everything apart that he can get his hands on. He publishes a lot of blogs about his tests, probably to be found on the site of http://loginvsi.com, where he pretends to be the product manager.'

name: Rex Jones II
note: Nominated by Sanjay Kumar: 'A community himself, words are less to define him. A man who redefined the manual testing and made millions of people to understand the value of Testing!!'

name: Crystal Preston-Watson
note: Nominated for her work in accessibility and all her positive vibes in talks she gives, and she gives a lot.

name: Abby Bangser
note: Nominated by Danny Dainton: 'Abby is a superstar! A truly awesome SRE that continues to share her knowledge and experience with the testing community!!'

name: Chris Armstrong
note: Nominated by Michael: 'Chris is a big part of the testing community and has the most awesome Christmas tree office setup seen!'

weblinks.name: Chris Armstrong – Posting about Testing, Agility, Leadership, Mental Health, Quality Practices and More

name: Melissa Fisher
note: Melissa gave an awesome talk at the internal EasyJet Test Guild last week, has really made a lot of the product teams think differently about usability and how we can test it

name: Joe Paul
note: Joe is an excellent cheerleader for the Testing Community. One of our excellent Tester of The Day Volenteers helping find great testers every week. Thank you Joe!

name: Naveen Khunteta
note: Nominated by Sanjay Kumar: 'A tutor who made many careers by his extra ordinary teaching skills, working really hard for community and making sure to share his best knowledge!!'

name: Michael
note: Michael is doing a truly fantastic job supporting the Testing Community with his excellent nominations for Tester of the Day. One of our first volunteers to cover a weekly slot.

name: Noemi Ferrera
note: Recently interviewed by the excellent Sneha Viswalingam for 'Code her Stories' Noemi provides insight into interview prep for a SDET role.

weblinks.name: SDET Interview Preparation with Noemi Ferrera

name: Kristin Jackvony
note: Kristin's dedication to producing well written, super informative blog posts each week, on a wide range of tech topics is so awesome!!

name: Heather Reid
note: Nominated by Michael: 'Heather is a part of the testing community through the Ministry of Testing and paying things forward via giving away tickets to the Ministry of Testing Holiday Bash A great way to pay it forward, the testing way!'

name: Binni Rattanpal
note: Nominated by Beth Marshall: 'She is an incredibly positive and enabling person to work alongside, who has created a community of practice at work, alongside doing a podcast and other awesome things this year.'

name: Kushan Amarasiri
note: Nominated by Dilshani Masachchi: 'Kushan is creative, energetic, solutions oriented and highly motivated with great communication skills. Also he is very enthusiastic about the latest technologies as well. he is an asset to any company that he’s with. He is great mentor, Leader and Trainer for the testing Community. He had a all rounded skills in Automation framework development.'

name: Nagesh
note: Nominated by Armate: 'for his tremendous work towards testing practice and commendable help to communities. he shares his knowledge in various talks and arrange many community testing events. Kudos to him.'

name: Sajith Varma
note: Nominated by Stu: 'Sajith is a manual tester who has learned enough code to automate his tests which are now in our codebase! Sajith is positive, proactive and an inspiring friend and colleague, I love working with him!'

name: Dawid Dylowicz
note: Nominated by Elias Nogueira: 'Dawid has the https://softwaretestingweekly.com initiative and is promoting the QA's articles and blog posts in a curated list. This is an awesome job and a real community one, promoting others.'

name: Suman Bala
note: Nominated by Danny Dainton: 'When Suman's not absolutely crushing Workshops and Meetup talks, she's building new connections and forming relationships with the wider Testing community! Such a wonderful thing to see!!'

name: Clare Norman
note: Nominated by Michael: 'Clare shares the most wonderful sketchnotes, covering testing keynotes. A great way to share the testing knowledge!'

name: Parveen Khan
note: Nominated by Simon: 'Parveen's testing tour has been inspirational and really proves that you can learn new things if you want to. She's a great asset to the testing and wider software communities'

name: Oliver Jumpertz
note: Oliver recently share an hilarious analogy comparing not testing software to 'getting in your car, disabling the airbag, not wearing a seatbelt and hoping for the best while driving into crazy traffic on the highway!'. Be like Oliver, remember your seatbelt, test early, test often!

name: Sanjay Kumar
note: Nominated by Joe Paul: 'A true community guy who is working full time for community for FREE & making millions of life easy by his innovations!!'

name: Joe Colantonio
note: Nominated by Shey Crompton: 'One of the most engaged and hard-working people in the industry. Always professional, informative, and helpful.'

name: Stu Day
note: Nominated by Dave Rutt: 'for his fantastic efforts with his talks linking Agile and testing. We had him at NottsTest this month - excellent test leader!'

name: Shane Carroll
note: Shane absolutely crushed his recent talk at Agile Testing Days - Sharing all his awesome Postman knowledge with more people in the wider community.

name: Lee Marshall
note: Nominated by Michael: 'Lee shares his views on all things testing and also shares his non testing focused experiences with money, investments etc'

name: Beth Marshall
note: Nominated by Marie Drake: 'Beth has just completed her test automation portfolio and she is such an inspiration for anyone wanting to learn more about test automation. She will also speak at a future Postman conference!'

name: Richard Bradshaw
note: Nominated by Michael: 'great work keeping focused and calm through testing times'

name: Thomas Rinke
note: Nominated by Tobias Geyer: 'for raising others in the community up and giving them visibility. He's a cheerleader in the best sense.'

name: Antonella Scaravilli
note: Winning for the second time, Antonella has been at it again producing excellent Sketchnotes this time for Agile Testing Days 2020

name: Andrei Contan
note: Nominated by Tobias Geyer: 'for supporting knowledge exchange in the testing community. He's co-organizing a very well run conference (@RomaniaTesting), shares his knowledge in various talks which also get very personal and he's making people realize that doing exercise while testing is possible with his XTestathon concept.'

name: Tobias Geyer
note: Nominated by Thomas Rinke: 'for delivering a talk on 'Ethics and Software Development', always helping and supporting the testing community, and today helping me to reflect on a talk'

name: Sophie
note: Nominated by Thomas Rinke: 'for delivering a courageous talk about mental health at #AgileTD. Thank you for sharing your story and raising awareness.'

name: Andy Bailey
note: Andy has been sharing some great articles from around the software industry. Recently he shared a Browser Stack article about Device Fragmentation, a very important topic in software testing.

name: Arslan Ali
note: Arslan is part of no less then 3 separate sprints this week, and still found time to engage with the #TestingCommunity.

name: Sebastian
note: Sebastian is smashing it responding to MoT questions in Twitter. With excellent insights into what Selenium and Appium is, and isn't.

name: Neil Studd
note: Nominated by Thomas Rinke for: 'creating @TestersIsland and now being the host of my favorite podcast again. Neil's passion as host is amazing and the way this podcast combines thoughts on various areas of testing with getting to know people of the testing community is wonderful.'

name: Alex Schladebeck
note: With two nominations Alex is 'A passionate speaker, sharing her passion for exploratory testing, reminding us of the importance of self-care' and 'outstanding example of a tester and person that we should all strive to be!'

name: Amber Race
note: Amber is an outright legend in the Testing Community. Her course 'Exploring Service APIs through Test Automation' on TAU is THE goto recourse for anyone learning API Testing. In the course she delivers excellent technical in an accessible and tester focused way that is simply excellent.

name: Irja Straus
note: Nominated by Arlene Andrews: 'Irja has always been a supportive person, and her talk https://youtu.be/q5K-iUFg-kA?t=1417 has shown how much of a superstar this one is!'

name: Theresa Neate
note: Nominated by Thomas: 'I recently saw her talk at #TestBash Australia 2019 online and it helped me to shape a better understanding of devops.'

name: Samuel Nitsche
note: Samuel is smashing it responding to the Ministary of Testing regular Twitter Questions, recently providing great insight RE: vocabulary and terminology

name: Lisa Crispin
note: Our first two-times winner! Lisa recently posted a fantastic article 'Shifting left & right in our continuous world'. Well done Lisa, we salute you!

name: Marissa
note: Nominated by Ben: 'From finding bugs via the console to compliment UI testing to excitement about Test Bash talks, Marissa's shows a love of Software Testing that is inspiring.'

name: Raghav Pal
note: Nominated by Faiz: 'for teaching for free using his YouTube channel AutomationStepByStep'

name: Julia Pottinger
note: Nominated by Marie: 'for doing an amazing Ask Me Anything session during Test.Bash('Online') as well as being a great example of an amazing woman in tech! She has contributed a lot to the testing community by being a YouTube content creator, TAU instructor, tech blogger to name a few.'

name: Simon Tomes
note: Nominated by Simon Prior: 'for being THE voice on exploratory testing. If you want to know more about it, he has so many great resources.'

name: Ajay Balamurugadas
note: Nominated by Sunny: 'He is not only a Subject matter expert in testing but a good teacher and motivator as well.  He inspires you to always learn, respect every opportunity and think critically'

name: Pedro Gonzalez
note: Nominated by Simon: 'for his inspiring talk on leadership at TestBash Netherlands. It really landed with a lot of the audience'

name: Drew Pontikis
note: Nominated by Karo: 'Drew is an incredibly kind human being who excels at building communities where people can thrive, learn and support each other. A true blessing for the test community!'

name: Georgia Bloyce
note: Nominated by Dan: 'for sharing her experience, demonstrating huge value as a colleague and lifting my spirits.'

name: Syam
note: Nominated by Faiz: 'for all the contributions for testing community like insightful posts/articles and for creation of TAQELAH Testing community and for creating Relative Xpath Chrome Extension tool'

name: Ady Stokes
note: Nominated by Simon: 'for his amazing knowledge and passion for accessibility testing, his talk at Test Bash Manchester was immense and really helped me learn more around #a11y'

name: Giridhar Rajkumar
note: Nominated by Julia who says: 'Not only is he an amazing individual that made my very first podcast experience fun and interesting but he really gives back to the community through his course on Test Automation University (https://testautomationu.applitools.com/cucumber-java-tutorial/) as well as his testing paradise podcast. https://learndevtestops.com/podcasts/'

name: Violetta Zhdanovich
note: Nominated by Christian who says: 'Seeing her development over the last 6 month is both: Amazing and inspiring! From not knowing a mobile app we re-developed to becoming the 'single source of truth' about the application. Also, developing from junior to leading the testing and doing most of the execution, and in parallel everybody in the team enjoys working with her a lot.'

name: Brijesh Deb
note: Nominated by Faiz who says: 'His contributions to testing community including Insightful Posts, Blogs/Articles, Sharing his knowledge by Speaking in different conferences. And for creation of The Test Chat Community for testers.

name: Rob Meaney
note: Nominated by Dan 'for helping point me in the right direction on some Testability questions'

name: Joshua Niemczyk
note: Nominated by Matthew 'for his ongoing curiosity and tenacity to keep moving forward. He’s had professional knocks but he gets back up and keeps driving to develop, learn and improve testing in whatever team he’s in.'

name: Mark Lilley
note: Mark made me laugh after a long week with his pun-tastic performance testing jokes. With blogs on testing topics such as JMeter with Redis, Mark clearly knows how to Perform under Stress along with handling his work Load.

name: Tomislav Delalic
note: Nominated Antonella, who has learned a lot from Tomisval and I considers him to been a great influence to a lot of testers.

name: Hanna Dernbrant
note: Nominated by Chris, who says 'A Quality Catalyst hitting the speaking circuit this year talking about her journey from waterfall to DevOps'

name: Ron Harley
note: Nominated by Mo who says Ron is 'He’s ALL hands on deck ALL the time. A test geek, runs a test event down in Florida. He’s brilliant!'

name: Clare Norman
note: Self described 'Colourful tester' Claire shares her knowledge of testing visually through fantastic colourful Sketchnotes. Claire is also a great supporter of others and shares some great content from the Testing Community!

name: Sergio Freire
note: Sergio's excellent content includes an introduction to Model based testing. He recently ported a MBT example from Java to Python. Sergio offers great insight into a number of other topics on his blog at https://www.sergiofreire.com/.

name: Vern Kofford
note: Vern has recently completed some courses on The Test Automation University. Well done Vern, we look forward to hearing how you put your learning to good use!

name: Michael Mintz
note: Always adding value Michael has created the goto Python Selenium Framework, SeleniumBase. Full of positive energy Michael is always building on his success and help bring others with him.

name: Tristan Lombard
note: Nominated by Chris: 'Compere extraordinaire, but also an all round supportive and engaging chap!'

name: Elias Nogueira
note: Elias consistently Tweets excellent Software testing content promoting others as well as producing his own excellent articles.

name: Ali Hill
note: Nominated by @PeetRonics who says: 'I've first met him at the Edinburgh chapter of the MoT Meetup. Very approachable and friendly guy. Always ready to help out others'

name: Andrew Knight
note: Andrew, AKA 'The Automation Panda' offers an excellent and inspirational insight into what it is to be a Software Engineer in Test (SET). He offers further excellent insights in a range of articles on the https://automationpanda.com/ blog. Check it out!

name: David Williams
note: Deborah Reid nominated David: 'for always looking out for me and being such a great friend and colleague and teaching me lots about testing'

name: Lisa Crispin
note: Nominated by the excellent Ileana who says of Lisa: 'She’s an absolutely amazing member of this community. She always encourages others to share ideas and she helps all of us with hers! It’s encouraging.'

name: Jan Giacomelli
note: A Senior #Python Engineer, Jan frequently posts helpful content on Pytest. Thank you Jan for your contributions to the #SoftwareTesting community.

name: Mark Tomlinson
note: A helpful performance tester . Mark is willing to help anybody and perfbytes is a great platform to learn and ask questions

name: Danny Dainton
note: Nominated for always answering the easy and hard questions about Postman no matter which corner of the Internet you happen to ask them!

name: Carlos Kidman
note: Big shout out to Carlos for live-streaming his test automation efforts on Twitch. https://twitch.tv/carloskidman

name: Angie Jones
note: She is willing to help anyone and her knowledge is immense. Angie has great positive energy and supports the Software Testing Community in countless ways.

name: Ramiro Cibrián
note: Ramiro recently took the time to write a excellent thread about QA for Games, with some great very important insight that is very relevent to all areas of software testing.

name: Michael Bolton
note: Nominated anonymously, today's winner consistently asks the big questions and producing awesome content. He helps others learn and is vocal on how to test many contexts.

name: Matt Hutchison
note: Nominated by Arlene Andrews, who says:'In a world where many wonderful people are writing, it's nice to have a weekly look at the articles specific to testing. Having this, and seeing the range of experience and care that is taken is always a delight.'

name: Richard Bradshaw
note: Nominated anonymously, today's winner is THE BossBoss! He is strengthening the testing global community with his leadership of the Ministry of Testing.

name: Adam Sandman
note: Nominated by the ever generous @ArleneAndrews_1 who says: ‘Adam has been generous in helping keep a community going, and provides a nice treat once a week with the Webinar.’

name: Ben Simo
note: Arlene Andrews nominates Ben 'A wonderful bug magnet, and one who has taught me to think outside  the box - not just cling to the edges.'

name: Matthew Parker
note: Nominated by none other then Heather Reid, Matt has given the testing community a lot to smile about today especially & reminded us all of some really wonderful times. He's also a wonderful volunteer, helping so many people behind the scenes!

name: Elisabeth Hocke
note: In addition to generally being a wonderful contributor to the testing community and being current MIATPP, she has given a wonderful webinar today sharing her story of #Ensembling and rasing awareness for the importance of words.

name: Lalitkumar Bhamare
note: Lalitkumar proposes the a Quality Conscious Software Delivery framework that focuses on People, Project, Process and Product. This builds towards whole team testing.

name: Antonella Scaravilli
note: Emna Ayadi nominates Antonella for 'Her active participation in online testing meetups and conferences, for inspiring me to make sketchnotes and organizing an awsome #testersvirtualcoffee together by synchronizing everything perfectly'

name: Ileana Herrera
note: Emna Ayadi nominates Ileana for 'Her active participation in online testing meetups and conferences, for inspiring me to make sketchnotes and organizing an awsome #testersvirtualcoffee together by synchronizing everything perfectly'

name: Al
note: Simon Prior nominated Al 'for his awesome talk on shifting testing left at the @MoTBucks meetup. Really engaging and hopefully the first of many talks.'

name: Ali Khalid
note: Simon Prior nominations Ali for 'for his awesome and really insightful DevOps Test Strategy Mindmap. So much to think about and implement...'

name: Vernon McRichards
note: Nominated by Marie Drake, who says 'He made my first AMA experience really engaging and the conversations pre-AMA were fun Smiling face with open mouth'

name: Arlene Andrews
note: Arlene has stared in Podcasts, presented and written blogs. Arlene is also a huge supporter of the Testing Community and Tester of The Day.

name: Corina Pip
note: For those that need a smile, or something that makes you feel like there is one person out there than understands, the drawings are awesome. And then there's the information-full presentations.

name: Jonathan Burton
note: He was instrumental in testing a successful android app launch. His attention to detail is unmatched!

name: Chris Armstrong
note: Podcaster, one of the Testing Peers and runs his own blog. Chris is a cheerleader for the Test Community. He has also been a huge supporter of Tester of The Day. Thank you Chris!

weblinks.name: Chris Armstrong – Posting about Testing, Agility, Leadership, Mental Health, Quality Practices and More

name: Ard Kramer
note: For being such an inspiration and all the hard work Ard is doing with Emna are doing together in their personal time for the #21stskills4testers coming book.

name: Beren Van Daele
note: Without Beren, we wouldn't have @TestSphere or #RiskStorming. Frankly the world is a better place with those things in it!

name: David
note: David makes the @testingpeers podcast actually sensible(ish) and he is also by far and away the easiest to transcribe when he talks!

name: Wicked Witch of the test
note: Insanely positive, grounded and is going to be one of the best conference speakers that we will see this year!

name: Lee Marshall
note: Lee shares excellent videos and readily shares his knowledge of testing SQL and building communities of practice. His Testers hang out has kept more than one of us sane during lockdown!

name: Sanne Visser
note: A Blockchain tester Sanne is supportive and has shared some excellent Sketchnotes from Online Test Conf.

name: Simon Prior
note: Simon is is positive and selflessly giving to a fault! He is the reason that @testingpeers even have a podcast!

name: Dan Ashby
note: Dan is a podcaster and blogger who is quoted everywhere. His block on interviewing testers is a must read! Dan also happens to be the inspiration for Tester of The Day!

name: Huib Schoots
note: A Quality Coach and Agile Expert Huib is a giver of great, wonderfully blunt advice.

name: Shey
note: Chris Armstrongs's 'favorite #LeadershipThoughts giver'. Shey is so supportive and positive, it's infectious.

name: Russell Craxford
note: Russel is a Meetup host, giver of sage (pun intended) advice, understated hero in the testing world and conference volunteer

name: Bruce
note: Bruce is humble, witty, creative, addictive to get to know, smart as hell and super supportive.

name: Maaret Pyhäjärvi
note: Maaret has time for everyone, broke down boundaries for conference #CFP, blogs so insightfully.

name: Zeger Van Hese
note: Zeger is hands down the most engaging speaker Chris Armstrong has ever seen in person.

name: Melissa Benua
note: Melissa has worked HARD to make sure that testing is incorporated into the changes that we see in applications/sites/whatever is coming next.

name: Melissa Tondi
note: Melissa has been a powerhouse in the scene - it's grand to see her views on what a tester could be.

name: Bart knaack
note: Bart helps host a small remote meetup for everybody who misses the test community.

name: Wanda Hawkins-Kavanagh
note: Wanda celebrates those that are on the journey with her. Her posts on testing are rare, and that makes finding these gems of delight in understanding even more of a special thing.

name: Stu
note: Stu co-hosts @MoTBucks and his passion for quality shines through in all he does!

name: Emna Ayadi
note: Emna's presented an awesome talk at #tmatlc2020 on community of practices and gives so much to the community.

name: Beth Marshall
note: Beth has shown a passion for testing with great online talks. Beth is always happy to review and give feedback on ideas.

name: Maaike Brinkhof
note: Maaike's blog Journey into quality has an ongoing series: 10 years, 10 lessons.

name: Rafaela Azevedo
note: Check out Rafaela's excellent FREE course on Contract testing with PACT on the Test Automation University.

name: Marie Drake
note: Marie's excellent article on Debunking Accessibility Testing Myths covered on The Club by none other then Heather Reid and Tweeted out today by the Ministry of Testing. Well done Marie!

name: Chris McMahon
note: Thanks Chris, great insight into your Cucumber step about reverting from a destructive test.
